intro: Triglochin concinna var. deserticola, commonly known as the desert spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in saline or alkaline soils, often in wetlands or along the edges of salt flats. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread vegetatively, forming dense stands that stabilize soil and provide habitat for wildlife. Triglochin concinna var. deserticola is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, including high salinity and limited water availability.
